Title: Payroll Assistant
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Level 9, Lim Tower 3, 29A Nguyen Dinh Chieu, District 1, HCMC
Job Description:
Welcome to the job description page with the opening Payroll Assistant position. Let’s explore this opportunity together!

At Acclime, we seek for people who care about delivering honest, professional and quality advice to our extended business community. We value diversity, inclusion, and trust, and we search for extraordinary individuals who are excited about working in an international corporate service practice. If you are aligned with our core values and our goals to deliver the best value for our business community in Vietnam, then you are in the right place. We look forward to meeting you!

Our organisational culture is at the core of what we do. Our values define our identity, and our staff are part of the journey towards growth, development and success together with our clients and partners. We know companies with a strong culture and identity thrive the most in the long run, which is why our culture is a priority.

Now, let’s dive right into the job summary and explore the essentials of this exciting role.

Job summary.
In this exciting and challenging role, you will work in our Payroll Services & HR Consulting Team located in our HCMC office as Payroll Assistant. You will work closely with clients and be part of a team responsible for meeting all aspects of clients’ relevant payroll and other needs in accordance with the signed service agreements. This role will help you take your career to the next level, and we will be there with you to guide you throughout your professional growth and ensure you reach your true potential.
What you will do. A day in the life.
The Payroll Assistant will assist senior whilst working as part of a team responsible for all matters of clients’ relevant Payrolling and other Administration needs in accordance with the signed Engagement Letter. Sounds exciting? Let’s explore some of the key responsibilities of the position. On a given day, you will:
• Gathering, checking, collecting and managing data of timesheets, production efficiency data to make sure having right data for calculating salary, bonus
• Ensure all payroll sheets have full supporting documents, follow internal procedures are compliant with Vietnam Labor Standards, Social Medical Unemployment Insurances Law and Tax Regulations
• Process payments with required support via banks considering supplier requirements, on a timely and accurate basis
• Input and control data via Payroll software
• Preparing (print, classification and archive) hard copies of monthly Payroll documentations (salary table, SMUI report and PIT report) if requires
• Preparing and filing in master files for allocated clients
• Going out to work with the authorities for SMUI, Tax, other related offices
• Preparing monthly SMUI and PIT reports for review
• Undertake payroll related activities, including PIT and insurance needs
• Ensure the quality of everything that is undertaken by Acclime is of the highest international standards
• Involvement with the training and development of staff and internal standards so that quality is paramount at every stage.
Job Requirements:
• Graduate from a Vietnamese university with a major in Human Resources, Law, Foreign Language, Accounting or other related fields.
• Desire to work in a Vietnamese HR role within an international Business environment.
• Confident intermediate English (spoken and written).
• Confidence working with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).

Title: Supplier Quality Manager
Location: Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 1010 Raymur Avenue, Vancouver BC
Job Description:
Hi there, we’re Article. We’re a North American based furniture company creating remarkably better furniture experiences one sofa at a time. We’re looking for a Supplier Quality Manager to lead our dynamic and cross-functional Vendor Quality Team. As an expert in continuous improvement, you will lead our Vendor Quality Team who is responsible for quality audits, developing quality standards, training vendors and stakeholders on quality standards, and conducting corrective actions.


Why We Need You:

In the Quality team, the Supplier Quality Manager will lead our dynamic and cross-functional Vendor Quality Team. As an expert in continuous improvement, you will lead our Vendor Quality Team who is responsible for quality audits, developing quality standards, training vendors and stakeholders on quality standards, and conducting corrective actions.


Why Article?

While, we sell to the North American market, we work closely with a number of our manufacturing partners throughout Asia. As a result we have an office in Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam where we currently have around 60 Particles (people of Article) working.

As a Particle (people of Article), you will have a high level of autonomy to solve challenging, meaningful problems the best way you can. That means you’re trusted to explore solutions you believe will work best (you’re the expert, after all). You’ll do all this while growing your skills within a company that is redefining the furniture industry.


What you’ll be doing:

You’ll be leading a team of 12 Vendor Quality Leads and Specialists and collaborating with the Director of Quality and compliance at headquarters to define priorities, set goals, and establish and implement supplier quality management processes.

• Manage and develop an in-country team of Vendor Quality Leads and Specialists
• Collaborate with the Director of Quality & Compliance to define priorities, set goals, establish and implement supplier quality management processes;
• Ensure timely completion of projects and tasks by the in-region Vendor Quality Team based on the agreed priority and Service Level Agreements (SLA) with internal customers, including product concept risk assessment, Pre-Production review, process verification, product inspections and testings during New Product Introduction, Product Change, and Product Move;
• Manage Supplier CAPA process and work with the suppliers to ensure required root cause analysis being completed and implementation and effectiveness of corrective actions being verified;
• Lead the team to review & investigate product quality issues reported through customer claims and internal team escalations;
• Manage and improve supplier quality performance
• Collaborate with cross functional teams in Quality Incident resolution including validation and verification of retrofitted products as needed
• Ensure completion and improvement of Supplier Quality Audits, including supplier process capabilities and quality system assessment as required
• Conduct analysis on quality issues and product failures to identify and enable early detection including but not limited to assessing and improving Article quality standards for all products including inspections, testings, etc.
• Review and manage quality records, e.g. inspection & test reports, audit reports, and identify opportunities for improvement
• Develop training materials for in-person, and online training, and update documentation when standards or requirements change
• Lead training with the office in Vietnam on test standards, quality requirements, etc
• Work with Vendor Quality Team and cross-functional partners to update quality documentation and requirements, and ensure implementation
• Provide technical support to sourcing and product development teams when structural issues or quality issues are identified on samples or on launched products
Job Requirements:
• 8+ years of experience in furniture industry or other related manufacturing facilities
• 3+ years of experience in a Manufacturing or Supplier Quality Manager role
• Hands on experience in establishing and managing ISO9000 equivalent Quality Management systems
• Excellent written and verbal English communication
• Proficient in quality issue investigation, root cause analysis, and continuous improvement methodologies.
• Problem solving and cross-functional teamwork experience and collaboration skills
• Proven leadership and mentorship experience
• Ability to work autonomously with limited supervision/ direction using your best judgment and initiative
• Lead auditor experience in process, product, or quality system audits will be a bonus

Title: Vendor Quality Specialist (Testing)
Location: Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 1010 Raymur Avenue, Vancouver BC
Job Description:
Hi there, we’re Article. We’re a North American based furniture company creating remarkably better furniture experiences one sofa at a time. And as the Vendor Quality Specialist (Testing), you’ll report to the Vendor Quality Lead, adhering to established quality processes while driving continuous improvement in product performance.


Why We Need You:

Within the Vendor Quality Team, our Vendor Quality Specialist (Testing) will partner with third-party laboratories to coordinate quality performance and transit testing across product categories (Casegoods, Upholstery, Outdoor, Decor). Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to ensure product availability for lab testing. This fits into our larger need to look for new ways to delight customers with high-quality products and improve the overall users’ experience.

Why Article?

While, we sell to the North American market, we work closely with a number of our manufacturing partners throughout Asia. As a result we have an office in Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam where we currently have around 60 Particles (people of Article) working.

As a Particle (people of Article), you will have a high level of autonomy to solve challenging, meaningful problems the best way you can. That means you’re trusted to explore solutions you believe will work best (you’re the expert, after all). You’ll do all this while growing your skills within a company that is redefining the furniture industry.


What You’ll Do:
You’ll be part of a team of 5 Vendor Quality Specialists working to the determined quality process and improve the product quality performance.

• Established quality processes while driving continuous improvement in product performance. Work with labs and cross-functional teams to develop, update, and maintain testing standards and protocols.
• Contribute to establishing internal quality processes, templates, and inspection standards. Maintain and update a master list of testing protocols and reports for easy access and compliance.
• Partner with third-party laboratories to coordinate quality performance and transit testing across product categories (Casegoods, Upholstery, Outdoor, Decor).
• Analyze quality issue trends and test failures to implement preventative measures, including refining testing standards, and develop targeted tests and solutions.
• Manage test report storage and task completion across platforms like Pinfo, Wrike, Google Drive, and PLM systems. Coordinating with and monitoring third-party laboratories to ensure test reports are uploaded into the Pinfo or PLM system.
• Train vendors and internal stakeholders on quality and transit testing frameworks and expectations. Create and update training materials for in-person and online sessions, reflecting changes in testing standards or requirements.
• Offer technical support to Sourcing and Product Development teams for structural or quality issues identified in samples or launched products.
• Occasionally travel to factories to support testing where needed.
Job Requirements:
Who You Are:

• 5+ years’ experience in the furniture industry with 3+ years experience in consumer product testing.
• Solid experience with third-party testing labs for furniture and decor products.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving and cross-functional collaboration skills.
• Proven ability to develop training materials and train others on technical topics.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Vietnamese.
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
• Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
• Willing to travel is required.

Title: Product Developer (Casegoods)
Location: Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 1010 Raymur Avenue, Vancouver BC
Job Description:
Hi there, we’re Article. We’re a North American based furniture company creating remarkably better furniture experiences one sofa at a time. And as the Technical Product Developer (Casegoods), you’ll manage, communicate and educate internal partners and external vendors in all technical design and construction details to achieve the consistent execution of the original design intent.


Why We Need You:
In the Product team, the Technical Product Developer (Casegoods) will develop original product designs (OEM and ODM+) in the Casegoods category that meet Article’s Indoor furniture requirements. Day-to-day communication with the manufacturers, product design, quality and sourcing teams, arranging prototypes of new products, and monitoring the progress of all new Casegoods developments.


Why Article?

While, we sell to the North American market, we work closely with a number of our manufacturing partners throughout Asia. As a result we have an office in Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam where we currently have around 60 Particles (people of Article) working.

As a Particle (people of Article), you will have a high level of autonomy to solve challenging, meaningful problems the best way you can. That means you’re trusted to explore solutions you believe will work best (you’re the expert, after all). You’ll do all this while growing your skills within a company that is redefining the furniture industry.


What You’ll Do:

You’ll be part of 6 seasoned product professionals to develop original product designs in the Casegoods category. You will lead the review, assessment, and approval of Initial & Final Prototype review sessions for your projects, coordinating with Design, Category Management, Sourcing, Quality, Industrial Engineering and other cross-functional teams as required.

• Develop original product designs (OEM, ODM+) that meet Article’s Indoor furniture requirements. Work closely with the cross-functional teams to ensure Article's product standards are met.
• Communicate (OEM, ODM+) Casegoods design briefs and technical drawing packages to the manufacturing partners. Review prototypes and make technical construction recommendations, ensuring that the product meets the specifications of design briefs.
• Work closely with your Product Development Lead to create and develop shared Development tools and best practices for Article. Participate in pre-production meetings and production verification activities, ensuring that the vendor is executing according to the technical specifications.
• Continuously conduct product research to gain an understanding of new product innovations and construction advancements. Observe product trends and new offerings through market research, trade shows and factory visits.
• Cultivate an understanding of costs associated with raw materials, design detail choices and vendor manufacturing capabilities and proficiencies.
• International travel to Indonesia, Malaysia, China, Canada, and the USA may be required.
Job Requirements:
Who You Are:

• 5+ years’ experience with developing Casegoods furniture is required.
• Strong technical background in Casegoods furniture with in-depth knowledge of Casegoods furniture construction, materials, production processes, testing requirements and quality defects.
• Effective analytical and problem-solving skills with excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
• Excellent organizational and time management skills to ensure timely completion of multiple projects with competing deadlines.
• Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
• Proficient with G-Suite / Microsoft Office Suite and related software for tech.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Vietnamese.
